questionset.title: Data Provider: Definitions
questionset.help: The following questions refer to the definitions of Open4usage and DQ4usage. Open4usage specifies the license and the openness of the data according to 5-star deployment scheme. DQ4usage sets the minimum quality criteria to be fulfilled for the usage of the data.

question.help:
Define license demands of collected input datasets for further usage.
Open4usage defines the openness criteria for usage of data.
question.text: Define license for Open4usage.

question.help:
Define Tim Berners-Lee five stars deployment scheme for open data (see https://5stardata.info/en/).
Open4usage defines the openness criteria for usage of data.
question.text: Define necessary Berners-Lee five stars for Open4usage.

question.help: Define the data quality level/thresholds for usage of collected input datasets.
question.text: Define DQ4usage.

questionset.title: Data Curator: Definitions
questionset.help: The following questions refer to the definitions of DM4processing, DQ4processing, DM4analysis and DQ4analysis. DM4processing and DQ4processing are levels of data maturity and data quality necessary for processing the data. The data analysis requires the data maturity criteria DM4analysis and the data quality criteria DQ4analysis.

question.help: Define the data maturity level/thresholds for processing the datasets
question.text: Define DM4processing.

question.help: Define the data quality level/thresholds for processing datasets.
question.text: Define DQ4processing.

question.help: Define the data maturity level/thresholds for analysing the datasets
question.text: Define DM4analysis.

question.help: Define the data quality level/thresholds for analysing datasets.
question.text: Define DQ4analysis.

questionset.title: Data Publisher: Definitions
questionset.help: The following questions refer to the definitions of DM4publication, DQ4publication, Open4publication, DM4archiving, DQ4archiving and Open4archiving. If a dataset shall be published, it must fulfil the data maturity DM4publication, the data quality DQ4publication and the openness Open4publication (license and openness). For archiving the data the criteria are built accordingly.

question.help: Define the data maturity level/thresholds for publishing the datasets
question.text: Define DM4publication.

question.help: Define the data quality level/thresholds for publishing datasets.
question.text: Define DQ4publication.

question.help:
Define license demands of dataset publication.
Open4publication defines the openness criteria for publishing of data.
question.text: Define license for Open4publication.

question.help:
Define Tim Berners-Lee five stars deployment scheme for open data (see https://5stardata.info/en/).
Open4publication defines the openness criteria for publishing of data.
question.text: Define necessary Berners-Lee five stars for Open4publication.

question.help: Define the data maturity level/thresholds for archiving the datasets
question.text: Define DM4archiving.

question.help: Define the data quality level/thresholds for archiving datasets.
question.text: Define DQ4archiving.

question.help:
Define license demands of dataset archiving.
Open4archiving defines the openness criteria for archiving of data.
question.text: Define license for Open4archiving.

question.help:
Define Tim Berners-Lee five stars deployment scheme for open data (see https://5stardata.info/en/).
Open4archiving defines the openness criteria for archiving of data.
question.text: Define necessary Berners-Lee five stars for Open4archiving.

questionset.title: Data Provider: Collect Data
questionset.help: The collection of data is described in the first phase of the data life cycle. Please specify one or multiple datasets that will be (potentially) collected. A dataset can include several files with common characteristics, such as sources or license.

question.help: Please describe the sources of the collected data by referencing the related repository or data provider.
question.text: How and where do you collect data?

question.help: The collected dataset has to be usable as defined in Open4usage. If the license does not allow usage, you should use another dataset with a proper license.
question.text: Did you ensure the openness for data usage according to the Open4usage criteria?

question.help: The quality of the dataset has to fulfil DQ4usage criteria. If the quality does not meet the requirement, or is not described in such way that can be used to evaluate, the dataset must be omitted.
question.text: Did you ensure the data quality for data usage?

question.help: Metadata are core for the evaluation and interpretation of a dataset.
question.text: Is metadata available?

questionset.title: Data Provider: Metadata Usage
questionset.help: Often the existing metadata must be complemented by metadata elements that are necessary for further usage of the data after the collection phase. Metadata includes general elements, domain specifiv elements, and data quality.

question.help: Metadata Extraction
question.text: Is it possible to extract further metadata (possibly automatically)?

question.help: Data Quality Extraction
question.text: Is it possible to extract further data quality (possibly automatically)?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Metadata Enriching
questionset.help: The data curator can potentially enrich the metadata by additional elements. This is mostly done manually.

question.help: If the initial set of metadata does not fulfil project needs additional metadata and data quality measures must be added.
question.text: Can the metadata/data quality be enriched?

question.help: Describe the additional metadata fields and/or data quality measures that have to be included in order to fulfil project needs. The DQ4processing is an appropriate guideline here.
question.text: How can metadata be enriched? What fields do you plan to add?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Quality Control
questionset.help: The quality control step plays an important role in the quality assurance workflow. Several phases of the data life cycle can benefit from quality control. Therefore a careful decision must be made.

question.help: An intermediate quality control step is especially useful, if the input data is derived from own measurements. If such data shall be published directly, a quality control is recommended. Apart from self-measured data a quality control step is advised for data in impact research.
question.text: Is an intermediate quality control necessary?

question.help: A quality control can consist of different methods depending on data type, potential usage, target community. DQ4processing is an appropriate guideline here.
question.text: Describe the method for quality control of this dataset.

question.help: Fitness for purpose (utility) and fitness for use (warranty) depict important goals of a dataset to be potentially reused.
question.text: Which methods/indicators are used to evaluate the fitness for purpose/use using the results of the quality control?
Describe the results of the evaluation of fitness for purpose/use.

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of indicators and/or other results is strongly recommended.
question.text: Are the indicators or other results from fitness for purpose/use included in the metadata?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Data Maturity Handling
questionset.help: The data maturity is an important concept of data meeting the usage requirements. For the next phase the data must reach level 2 data maturity.

question.help: The data maturity's evaluation follows the DM4processing criteria in the data maturity matrix. If the dataset shall be published without processing/analyse phases, DM4publication must be fulfilled.
question.text: Did you evaluate the data maturity of datasets in collection phase?

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of data maturity indicators is strongly recommended.
question.text: Did you include the level of data maturity in the metadata?

question.help: In the case of proceeding to processing phase, DM4processing and DQ4processing must be fulfilled. If the data shall be directly published (e.g. own measurements) DM4publication and DQ4publication must be met.
question.text: Give an estimation of data maturity and data quality indicators for all input datasets.

questionset.title: Data Provider: Process Data
questionset.help: The processing of data is the second step in the data life cycle. Please specify one or multiple datasets to be processed. The same datasets will be used for the analysing phase. A dataset is not necessarily one file only. It is possible and advised to aggregate similar types of data to be processed and analysed if they share general properties (e.g. topic, type)

question.help: Describe the model workflow you create/develop. The single steps depending on the supposed granularity should be mentioned here. Also include the used input datasets according to the collection phase here.
question.text: Describe the data processing.

question.help: The extraction of metadata can either be made manually or automatically (if possible).
question.text: Is it possible to extract metadata from the produced dataset?

question.help: The extraction of data quality can either be made manually or automatically (if possible). The choice of data quality measures shall follow domain specific rules.
question.text: Is it possible to extract data quality measures from the produced dataset?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Metadata Enriching
questionset.help: The data curator can potentially enrich the metadata by additional elements. This is mostly done manually.

question.help: If the initial set of metadata does not fulfil project needs additional metadata and data quality measures must be added.
question.text: Can the metadata/data quality be enriched?

question.help: Describe the additional metadata fields and/or data quality measures that have to be included in order to fulfil project needs. The DQ4analysis is an appropriate guideline here.
question.text: How can metadata and data quality be enriched? What fields/elements do you plan to add?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Quality Control
questionset.help: The quality control step plays an important role in the quality assurance workflow. Several phases of the data life cycle can benefit from quality control. Therefore a careful decision must be made.

question.help: A quality control at this step should include basic tests to ensure the basic functionality and characteristics of this dataset to be used in further steps.
question.text: Is an intermediate quality control advised?

question.help: A quality control can consist of different methods depending on data type, potential usage, target community. DQ4analysis is an appropriate guideline here.
question.text: Describe the method for quality control of this dataset.

question.help: Fitness for analysis examines the potential usage of this dataset in further steps in the data life cycle.
question.text: Which methods/indicators are used to evaluate the fitness for analysis using the results of the quality control?
Describe the results of the evaluation of fitness for purpose/use.

questionset.title: Data Curator: Data Maturity Handling
questionset.help: The data maturity is an important concept of data meeting the usage requirements. For the next phase the data must reach level 3 data maturity.

question.help: The data maturity's evaluation follows the DM4analysis criteria in the data maturity matrix.
question.text: Did you evaluate the data maturity of datasets in processing phase?

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of data maturity indicators is strongly recommended.
question.text: Did you include the level of data maturity in the metadata?

question.help: In order to proceed to the analysis phase DM4analysis and DQ4analysis must be fulfilled.
question.text: Give an estimation of data maturity and data quality indicators for all processed datasets.

questionset.title: Data Provider: Analyse Data
questionset.help: The analysis of data is the third step in the data life cycle. The datasets here are the same like in the processing phase. A dataset is not necessarily one file only. It is possible and advised to aggregate similar types of data to be processed and analysed if they share general properties (e.g. topic, type)

question.help: Describe the planned analysis of the dataset. The analysis shall examine the data in depth. This is a reasonable basis for further usage of the data.
question.text: Describe the data analysis.

questionset.title: Data Curator: Fitness for Purpose/Use
questionset.help: The fitness for purpose (utility) and use (warranty) are general properties of the data. In the analysis phase they should be evaluated in order to assess the usability of the data for own purposes as well as further usage in other research projects/communities.

question.help: The evaluation of the fitness for purpose/use is an important step in the analysis phase.
question.text: How can you evaluate the fitness for purpose/use of the data?

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of indicators and/or other results and descriptions is strongly recommended.
question.text: Are indicators/descriptions of fitness for purpose/use included in metadata?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Quality Control
questionset.help: The quality control step plays an important role in the quality assurance workflow. Several phases of the data life cycle can benefit from quality control. Therefore a careful decision must be made.

question.help: A quality control at this step is typically necessary. It is a quantified proof of your data.
question.text: Is a quality control advised?

question.help: A quality control can consist of different methods depending on data type, potential usage, target community. DQ4publication is an appropriate guideline here.
question.text: Describe the method for quality control of this dataset.

question.help: Fitness for publication examines the potential usage of this dataset in further steps in the data life cycle.
question.text: Which methods/indicators are used to evaluate the fitness for publication using the results of the quality control?
Describe the results of the evaluation of fitness for purpose/use.

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of indicators and/or other results is strongly recommended.
question.text: Are the indicators or other results from fitness for purpose/use included in the metadata?

questionset.title: Data Curator: Data Maturity Handling
questionset.help: The data maturity is an important concept of data meeting the usage requirements. For the next phase the data must reach level 4 data maturity.

question.help: The data maturity's evaluation follows the DM4publication criteria in the data maturity matrix.
question.text: Did you evaluate the data maturity of datasets in analysis phase?

question.help: To foster potential usage of the data the inclusion of data maturity indicators is strongly recommended.
question.text: Did you include the level of data maturity in the metadata?

question.help: In order to proceed to the publication phase DM4publication and DQ4publication must be fulfilled.
question.text: Give an estimation of data maturity and data quality indicators for all analysed datasets.

questionset.title: Data Publisher: Publish Data
questionset.help: The publication of data is the fourth step in the data life cycle. The same datasets are used for publication and archiving phases. A dataset is not necessarily one file only. It is possible and advised to aggregate similar types of data to be publication and/or archived if they share general properties (e.g. topic, type)

question.help: Ensured Open4publication is mandatory for publishing the dataset.
question.text: Is Open4publication ensured?

question.help: The way of publication defines necessary metadata fields and file formats.
question.text: How and where do you publish the dataset?

question.help: Publication of datasets in repositories often leads to repository-specific metadata elements.
question.text: Describe the necessary adaption of metadata elements.

question.help: Is the adaption of metadata elements according to the specific needs of the repository finished?
question.text: Did you adapt metadata elements?
Did you publish the dataset?

question.help: In order to proceed to the archiving phase DM4archiving and DQ4archiving must be fulfilled.
question.text: Give an estimation of data maturity and data quality indicators for all analysed datasets.

questionset.title: Data Publisher: Archive Data
questionset.help: The archiving of data is the fifth step in the data life cycle. The same datasets are used for publication and archiving phases. A dataset is not necessarily one file only. It is possible and advised to aggregate similar types of data to be publication and/or archived if they share general properties (e.g. topic, type)

question.help: Ensured Open4archiving is mandatory for publishing the dataset.
question.text: Is Open4archiving ensured?

question.help: The way of archiving defines necessary metadata fields and file formats.
question.text: How and where do you archive the dataset?

question.help: Archiving of datasets in repositories often leads to repository-specific metadata elements.
question.text: Describe the necessary adaption of metadata elements.

question.help: Is the adaption of metadata elements according to the specific needs of the repository finished?
question.text: Did you adapt metadata elements?
Did you archive the dataset?
